sagex.phoenix.util

Class TextReplacement

  • java.lang.Object
    • sagex.phoenix.util.TextReplacement

  • public class TextReplacement
extends java.lang.Object
    Provides basic text replacements in a string using a mask and a TextReplacement.IVariableResolver.

    • Nested Class Summary

      Nested Classes 
      Modifier and Type Class and Description
      static interface  TextReplacement.IVariableResolver<T>
      Resolves a variable value with a given name.
      static class  TextReplacement.MapResolver
      Resolves the variable name against the passed map.

      • replaceVariables

        public static <T> java.lang.String replaceVariables(java.lang.String string,
                                                    T relation,
                                                    TextReplacement.IVariableResolver<T> replacements)
        Given a string that may contain variables, replace the variables with their (optionally formatted) values. The variables may be in one of three forms:
        1. ${name}
        2. ${name:class:format}
        3. ${name:StringFormat} (ie, "%02d", etc)
        In the first form, the variable named name is replaced with its value. In the second form, the variable named name is replaced with its value after that value has been formatted using the subclass of java.text.Format named in class and the format string (passed to the formatter's constructor) named in format.

        As an example of the second form, consider the variable SeasonNumber. To replace this variable with its integer value, formatted to always contain 2 digits (e.g. 1 is formatted to 01) use the variable ${SeasonNumber:java.text.DecimalFormat:00}

        As an example of the second form, consider the variable SeasonNumber. To replace this variable with its integer value, formatted to always contain 2 digits (e.g. 1 is formatted to 01) use the variable ${SeasonNumber:%02d}

        Parameters:
        string - The String whose variables are being replaced
        replacements - A Map whose keys are possible variable names and whose values are the Strings with which the variable should be replaced
        Returns:
        The given String with all possible variable substitutions made
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception
